title: [Bug]: core dump at start-up, GTK 2-3/4 symbols mix since 2.0.17 on RL9 (MATE)
body:
### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA?

Not applicable

### Describe the bug

tfl 2.0.17 does not start (crashes) on Rocky Linux 9 (MATE desktop) and yells about a GTK 2-3/4 symbols mix in output.

### What package are you using?

rpm

### Version

2.0.17

### Reproduction steps

```markdown
Start tfl 2.0.17 in Rocky Linux 9, within a MATE desktop:

$ cat /etc/system-release
Rocky Linux release 9.6 (Blue Onyx)

$ echo $DESKTOP_SESSION
mate

$ teams-for-linux
Initialising logger with config: {"transports":{"console":{"level":"info"},"file":{"level":false}}}
13:28:00.697 âº configPath: $HOME/.config/teams-for-linux
13:28:00.803 âº (node:3591249) [DEP0180] DeprecationWarning: fs.Stats constructor is deprecated.
(Use `teams-for-linux --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)

(process:3591249): Gtk-ERROR **: 13:28:00.809: GTK 2/3 symbols detected. Using GTK 2/3 and GTK 4 in the same process is not supported
teams-for-linux: line 9: 3591249 Trace/breakpoint trap   (core dumped) /opt/teams-for-linux/teams-for-linux
```

### Expected Behavior

tfl should start and work like 2.0.16 does.
When I saw the mention "GNOME Users: Electron 36+ defaults to GTK 4 on GNOME. If you experience theming issues, you can use GTK 3 mode." in the 2.0.17 release notes, I was pretty sure something could go wrong with 2.0.17, tried it and voila. Not sure this is a conflict with MATE (which is GTK3), I could not test yet in a GNOME desktop on RL9 yet.
